column4: can someone tell me how to install the 'make' command on my computer?
install the 'build-essential' package
yes, very much better :)
why is it better?
tons of reasons - udev, Xgl/compiz, beagle, Gnome 2.14 (which is massively optimized)
yeah, it's quite easy
explain please
replace 'Breezy' with 'Dapper' in the /etc/apt/sources.list file, and then run 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade'
could you explain in further detail? what do you mean replace breezy with dapper?
/etc/apt/sources.list is a text file that holds a list of all the software repositories
ok
Replacing any occurrence of 'Breezy' with 'Dapper' will make it use the repositories holding the Dapper versions of all apps.
ok
'sudo apt-get dist-upgrade' is the command that upgrades your entire system
thank you, will i need to restart my computer or just log out to finish the changes?
You'll need to restart - it replaces basically everything, including the kernel.
ok, thank you
np :)
will it keep my current settings, like themes and such, or will i need to redo all that

It will keep your settings.  It doesn't touch your home directory, where most config files relating to your stuff are stored, and if any system config files have been changed it will ask you whether to keep the old version or go to the newer one.
you still there?
